title: Psi Research and Parapsychology Programs (U.S. Intelligence)
summary: Historical CIA/DIA/NSA parapsychology research programs (Stargate, remote viewing) and modern DARPA neuroscience/brain-computer interface research

us_perspective.official_position: Historical psi research programs officially terminated in 1995 as 'not useful for intelligence operations'; modern focus on neuroscience and brain-computer interfaces
key_programs: DARPA N3 (Next-Generation Nonsurgical Neurotechnology, 2024-2025) - non-invasive brain-computer interfaces
DARPA RAM (Restoring Active Memory, 2024-2025) - memory enhancement via neural implants
DARPA Biocybernetics (1974) - early brain-computer interface research
key_actions: Donated research materials to Rice University Archives of the Impossible
Shifted focus to measurable neuroscience and BCI technology
N3 program funding six groups developing non-surgical brain interfaces (2024-2025)
RAM program developing implantable neural devices for TBI patients
us_perspective.historical_context: Cold War era research into potential psychic phenomena as potential intelligence tool; Soviet Union also had similar programs
concerns: Reputational damage if psi research seen as pseudoscience
Adversary development of unknown neurotechnology advantages
Dual-use concerns for neural weapons or mind control

russian_perspective.official_narrative: Soviet Union conducted extensive psychotronics research; modern Russia continues classified neuroscience programs
russian_perspective.media_framing: Western abandonment of psi research portrayed as strategic error; Russia maintains 'fuller' understanding of consciousness
key_quotes: Soviet psychotronics research was decades ahead of Western understanding - Russian military historians
russian_perspective.evolution: From paranormal research to neuroscience and electromagnetic effects on cognition
russian_perspective.current_programs: Classified - suspected focus on electromagnetic weapons, brain-computer warfare, consciousness manipulation

chinese_perspective.official_position: Qigong and traditional concepts integrated with modern neuroscience; state support for consciousness research
key_statements: Chinese military interest in 'shen ming' (consciousness/spirit) applications
Integration of traditional practices with brain-computer interface research
actions: State funding for consciousness research institutes
Military applications of meditation and mental training
Brain-computer interface development for military advantage
motivations: Leverage traditional Chinese understanding of consciousness
Enhance soldier performance through mental training

western_perspective.official_position: Scientific consensus: no evidence for paranormal phenomena; focus on neuroscience
western_perspective.media_framing: Stargate Project portrayed as Cold War curiosity with no practical results
western_perspective.key_differences: Emphasis on empirical neuroscience vs. Russian/Chinese openness to non-materialist consciousness models
